msContents.summary: Loan of two artabas of wheat with a yield of fifty percent; the borrower is Aurelius Areios

msItem.note: Broken on top and bottom; written along the fibers; the back is blank
14 lines of writing by two hands: the first upright and the second more inclined to the right

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman through H.I. Bell, in 1924; no. 13 (box XIVc) in Bell's inventory

div.ab: . . . the agreement set down in duplicate . . . [ is normative] wherever it is brought forward and for whoever presents it on your behalf. Having been asked by you whether these things are well and correctly done, I have consented. Year 5 of Imperator Caesar Marcus Aurelius Severus Alexander Pius Felix Augustus, Choiak 3. I, Aurelius Areios son of Sarapion, have had measured out to me two artabas of wheat, and I shall pay as yield one artaba, and I shall repay the total three artabas of wheat as aforesaid, and, having been asked the formal question, I have agreed . . . .
